Miscellaneous macros
[Macros and data types commonly used]


Defines

#define TABLESIZE(table)   (sizeof(table)/sizeof(table[0]))
 A macro returns the number of elements in a table.
#define MAX(x, y)   (((x) > (y))?(x):(y))
 A macro returns the maximum of x and y.
#define MIN(x, y)   (((x) < (y))?(x):(y))
 A macro returns the minimum of x and y.
#define ABS(x)   (((x)<0) ? -(x) : (x))
 A macro returns the absolute value of x.
#define CLAMP(x, low, high)   (((x) > (high)) ? (high) : (((x) < (low)) ? (low) : (x)))
 A macro returns the middle value of x, low and high.
#define ISSPACE(c)
 A macro returns the absolute value of c.
#define ISUPPER(c)   ((c) >= 'A' && (c) <= 'Z')
 A macro judge the value of c is a upper character.
#define ISLOWER(c)   ((c) >= 'a' && (c) <= 'z')
 A macro judge the value of c is a lower character.
#define ISALPHA(c)   (ISUPPER (c) || ISLOWER (c))
 A macro judge the value of c is a character.
#define TOUPPER(c)   (ISLOWER (c) ? (c) - 'a' + 'A' : (c))
 A macro returns the is a upper character. of value c.
#define TOLOWER(c)   (ISUPPER (c) ? (c) - 'A' + 'a' : (c))
 A macro returns the is a lower character. of value c.
